name: Short North - Italianate Cottage
description: Just steps from High Street and all the action, enjoy the entire house, and private patio!  Less than a mile South from OSU Campus and less than a mile North from the Columbus Convention Center. Our home was featured in Cincinnati Refined's article  "6 Unforgettable AirBnB Getaways in Columbus!" (2015) and Columbus Business First "Most-desired Airbnb listings in Central Ohio" (2017). We have hosted over 200 parties! Check out our reviews! Great Short North Home  which includes: First floor: Two first floor bedrooms with queen beds and full bath, large living space and kitchen Second floor: 350+ sqft open space with queen bed, private bathroom with huge OPEN shower, and large walk-in closet.  The house has central air, hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances and laundry facility. There is a fenced yard with a large patio!  There is also a front porch. Permitted / Paid Parking is available on surrounding streets (Say Avenue, E. Third Avenue, Mt. Pleasant, E. Fourth Avenue) via the PA
host_about:
Active, young professionals who love to travel and socialize! Audra loves to run, workout, and sip on adult beverages. 
Lacey loves to workout, check out local music & restaurants, and rescue any stray animal she sees.

name: Priv. 1st Flr Mattress - N.Campus
description: Once upon a time this was our living room. It's a nicely sized room currently with queen mattress and plenty of shelving. # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) This room is on the first floor right across from the bathroom. Your bathroom will be on the first floor. Washer and dryer are both located in the bathroom and are available for you to use at anytime.  You'll most likely be sharing the house with a couple others so expect people to be walking in and out going about their business daily, and be courteous in the way of dishes, etc. Same goes for the kitchen appliances, fridge, cupboard space, etc. I try to clean on a regular basis but much of the day to day cleaning relies on the guests keeping the common areas clean for one another. Be aware that the bedroom is located by the front door and you may hear the door open and close when people enter and exit. This generally doesn't bother people but please be aware. Guests have pretty much full access to everything. Shared bathroom on the
host_about:
Hello, hello.

About me: pretty easy going, basically.
Hobbies include gardening, woodworking, running, boxing, science, writing, photography, and some others.

That is all.

name: Private 2nd Floor Room -- N.Campus
description: Nicely sized room in a central location. Twin mattress available for you to sleep on with a closet available to store your stuff in. # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) This is a lightly furnished room with a twin bed and a secretaries desk. There is a closet which should be enough for most of your clothing as well. Your bathroom will be on the first floor. Washer and dryer are both located in the bathroom and are available for you to use at anytime.  You'll most likely be sharing the house with a couple others so expect people to be walking in and out going about their business daily, and be courteous in the way of dishes, etc. Same goes for the kitchen appliances, fridge, cupboard space, etc.  We've fully moved out of the house recently so you won't see us too much, maybe once or twice per week. Guests have pretty much full access to everything. Shared bathroom on the first floor, shared kitchen & kitchen utensils, etc. We probably won't run into each other too frequently but if you ha

name: The Bellows' Studio Loft  (3rd floor apartment)
description: Famous American artist George Bellows home with studio loft apartment, features a completely private oasis for two with private bath, kitchenette, dining and sitting areas. Walk to downtown with easy access to the freeway and public transportation. The homeowners are both artists and guests will enjoy the art that adorns the walls. There are several eateries within a 5 minute walk. And a new brewery!  Additionally, there are no security cameras in the unit. This historic home features a totally private and secure studio loft apartment, which is accessed through the spacious entry hallway. It has sitting and dining areas, bedroom with a queen size bed, kitchenette and private full bath. A quiet retreat with plenty of light and great views. The back yard features gardens with several sitting areas and a pond.  Guests are welcome to enjoy this quiet oasis from city life. The owners are both artists and would love to share their historic home with you. A historic neighborhood of beautiful
host_about:
My husband Eric and I are both artists, sharing studio space in our house. We have 2 daughters and 3 grandchildren, all of whom live in Columbus.  I've been a yoga teacher since 1988. I have taught at Yoga on High since it's inception in 2000 and earned my certification from Yoga Alliance of ERYT 500 at Yoga on High. I love sharing this ancient practice with all kinds of people. I have seen it have profound effects on people's lives. It is an honor and a responsibility for which I am very grateful. 
 Eric and I have lived in this historic home for over 35 years, in what we consider the best neighborhood in the city, Olde Towne. We love sharing our home with friends and now airbnb guests. We enjoy walking in the woods, gardening, biking, kayaking, reading and, of course, practicing yoga. 
We also love to travel. We've been told we are easy guests. We like to take care of ourselves and not add unduly to our hosts workload. Car camping is a favorite vacation of ours.
 I'd say our airbnb hosting style is also casual: I try to think of anything a guest might need and supply it, so they can have a relaxed stay with us. We have maps of the neighborhood and menus for the local cafes and the bakery in a notebook in The Loft. We try to help out with rides when we can. We have a table in The Loft that is perfect for working or dining. A guest set up her sewing machine up there.
My favorite quote is from Emmanuel: "Your life is not your master, it is your child." Let us host your next visit to Columbus as you create your perfect visit.

name: 2 bed/Family/Quiet/Clean/OSU/Short North/Airport
description: INSTANT BOOK! One of the nicest locations in Clintonville!  Right across the street is a SCENIC PARK and ravine!  Safe, cozy, quiet, comfortable FULL  2 BR (4 guest) RESIDENTIAL HOME  in the heart of Columbus!  Front of home ample street parking!  Minutes from everything! WELCOME to your home away from home! Kick back and cozy up here.  Hit the Short North streets just blocks away for fun and entertainment, or walk around the corner to an inviting gastropub, The Crest.  So much to do and most all is close by within only minutes.   I have updated my kitchen and bathroom with a nice trendy mid-century modern look and I offer one of the best locations in Clintonville (Columbus).  LOVELY PARK & Ravine across the street-FULL RESIDENTIAL -2 BEDROOM Home with ample street parking in front of my house, or park in garage out back.  Minutes from OSU STADIUM and much more!    Do you have an up and coming fun event in Columbus, a get-a-way OSU weekend, or business trip planned in Columbus?  Whethe
host_about:
Hi...I am a friendly, fun and artsy gal.  I have always thought of opening a bed & breakfast, now I offer you (and me) the next best thing.  

I have enjoyed hosting great folks for several years now.   Guests have told me time and again they find my home a warm comfortable alternative to the humdrum of the hotel/motel experience.   

I offer you a big smile, a hardy hand shake and a comfortable stay in my  cozy home away from home...enjoy!

name: Single Bed in a 5-Person Coed Dorm at the Hostel
description: The Wayfaring Buckeye Hostel is a social place to stay.  It is an international bed and breakfast in Columbus, Ohio.  We have five rooms (three shared dorms and two private rooms). Included items:  -Linens: towel, sheets, and bedding (we do not allow guest to bring their own bedding)  -Continental breakfast  -Free Wi-Fi  -Computer and printer access  -Free bicycles to borrow  -Two comfortable shared common rooms  -Cable TV  -24hr coffee or tea (self-serve) -6-person outdoor hot tub  -Free lockers  -Kitchen access (to cook or store your own groceries)  -Free use of the laundry machines (we have detergent for sale)  -Reading lights over each bed  -Borrowable DVD collection  -BBQ area  -Limited off street parking   -PLUS MUCH MORE!!! We have had guests from all over the world.  We know you will meet people, make friends, and maybe even partake in one of our many bar crawls or social events while staying with us. We are located in the vibrant University District.  There are many shops, bar
host_about: I'm an outgoing type who values the experience of travel.  Airbnb helps me to afford to travel more.  I love meeting new people.  I actually grew up in a Bed & Breakfast so hosting seems to come very naturally to me.

name: Comfortable rooms in Clintonville 1
description: A cozy, warm, inviting place to stay in the heart of Columbus.  This page is for the queen-size bed. The large bathroom is SHARED in the house with your own towels provided in your room. We live in a 1923 two-story craftsman-like house in the heart of Clintonville on a beautiful and neighborhood friendly street.  Our three-bedroom home has hardwood floors throughout, a spacious kitchen, a large outdoor living space consisting of a large porch with a permanent roof and a large paver patio with several areas for relaxing. The back yard is fenced in and has a large koi pond. We spend most of our summer out on the back porch; you will enjoy it as well if you are here in late spring to mid fall. We have two room options for booking, make sure you are booking through the right listing for the room you want: Comfortable rooms in Clintonville 1 This room is a 10' x 16' bedroom with a queen-sized bed, complete with a pillow top mattress for a wonderful night's sleep. It overlooks the backyard a
host_about: We enjoy hosting other people in our home. From neighbors for cocktail hour to hosting out of town family, we thrive on making the experience in our home one they won't forget and desire to come back to time and time again.

name: Better than a hotel! German Village
description: 2 Bedrooms (full/queen) - 2.5 baths - Living - Dininglounge - Large Kitchen - Wifi - Internet TV + AmazonPrime - Washer & Dryer Located in heart of historic German Village (literally). Steps from shopping, restaurants, & downtown Columbus, Ohio. Better than a hotel suite, this is an entire house! Beautifully renovated brick Italianate 145 year-old home. Fully furnished down to the linens, cork screw and martini glasses. The original architectural details blend wonderfully with the modern kitchen and baths. New and original hardwood and cork floors throughout.  Exposed brick walls. Furnished with an eclectic Mid-Century feel.  Perfect for the traveler who likes to experience the neighborhood, someone relocating to Columbus or in need temporary housing. If property not available, checkout our other listing, "GERMAN VILLAGE TOWNHOUSE IN THE SKY" German Village is a premier neighborhood in Columbus, Ohio, listed on the National Register of Historic Places. Fantastic amenities within walkin
host_about: Hi, I'm Jeff. I live work & play in German Village and downtown Columbus! I graduated from OSU in Hospitality Management and have a small design firm in the neighborhood. My partner Stevo is from Croatia and speaks 5 languages.  Our pup is GiGi! We welcome you to enjoy our home away from home, nestled in the heart of German Village.

name: Downtown! Beautiful Historic Old Oaks Home!
description: Located on a beautiful boulevard in the historic Old Oaks neighborhood just east of downtown Columbus, my spacious, fully remodeled w/ modern updates, 2400 sq ft home is perfect for large groups and gatherings. Look the 'hood up, it's very unique! **Note: This listing is to rent my entire home with complete privacy. For other options, visit my profile to access additional listings. I can also offer a discounted rate to book all but my master suite on the third floor. My home is a spacious, fully remodeled, 2400 square foot American Foursquare located in the historic Old Oaks neighborhood of Columbus, Ohio. I regularly rent to large groups for weddings, conferences, reunions and the like. It's the perfect place for large groups. The home features 4 bedrooms, and the following bed options: 2 queen size beds  2 full size beds  2 full size futons 1 twin size futon 1 couch  1 bay/reading window with custom mattress 2 queen size air mattresses 2 full size air mattresses These alone can sleep
host_about:
I'm a professional writer and marketer located in Columbus, OH. I am originally from WV, but moved here many moons ago to attend The Ohio State University and have since made this my home. I know nearly everything there is to know about Columbus, and if you're looking for more than a place to lay your head, I'm the host you want when visiting this city.

I spend most of my spare time reading, writing, running, dancing or riding my bicycle. I also enjoy a good happy hour and live shows.

name: Newly Renovated Charming Townhome
description: Great modernized town home in Merion Village.  Large kitchen with island, washer/dryer in basement, bright and airy bedrooms.  Perfect for corporate rentals, extended stays for the hospitals, or relocating to the area.  Close to German Village and .6 miles south of Nationwide Children's Hospital.  NO SMOKING   NO PETS As my guest, you have the entire townhouse to yourselves and are welcome to make use of the shared backyard. I live close by and am happy to help with directions, recommendations, and let you know my favorite spots in Columbus.  I am happy to help as needed! There is plenty of on street parking at the building.  Public transportation (COTA) is easily accessible and the freeways and surrounding areas are close if you have your own vehicle.  Cabs and Uber are other options to get around Columbus.
host_about: Hi!  I love to travel, make new friends, cook, entertain, and find adventure in my everyday life.  Point and click photo enthusiast and lover of new experiences- that's me!  I worked in the hospitality industry for many years before recently starting my own business.

description: Our newly renovated 1920's brick building is within walking distance to German Village and close to Children's Hospital.  Enjoy a gourmet kitchen, easy access to the interstate, and so many wonderful restaurants to choose from just a short distance away.  No Pets allowed and No Smoking.  As my guest, you have the entire townhouse to yourselves and are welcome to make use of the shared backyard. name: Charming 1BR Apt in Clintonville
description: Fantastic 1BR apartment located in the South Clintonville/North University District area, minutes from OSU or downtown. It is on the ground floor of a lovely 1926 4-unit brick building on Indianola near Arcadia.  It's beautifully furnished and is ideal for a single or couple who are visiting or relocating to Columbus. The apartment has hardwood floors, wood panel doors, double-hung windows with storm windows and screens, and it has the original 1926 bath and kitchen fixtures.  The kitchen has a full-sized gas stove, a small built-in microwave, a dark wood countertop, a hidden drop-down breakfast table, and a hidden drop-down ironing board. It is equipped with everything you need (toaster, coffee maker, plates, glasses, cups, pots, pans, silverware, and an assortment of utensils) to cook any sort of meal.  The adjoining hall space functions as a continuation of the kitchen and contains a full-sized refrigerator, a narrow hutch, and a utility/pantry closet.  Linens are provided for the b
host_about: I have lived in Columbus off and on since coming here to attend Ohio State University in the 60's.  I have a degree in Architecture from OSU, but my real interest has always been in renovations. I have a son who lives in San Francisco and I love to visit there several times a year.  My husband and I have 3 grandchildren - one in California and two in Michigan.  I recently retired from OSU after working there for 18 years.

name: Urban Oasis near Short North, OSU, Grandview Yard
description: Victorian Village Guest House is a private guest suite located in the carriage house on the host's property. You will be the only guest here and are invited to enjoy our patios and garden.  Our location is super convenient and walkable. We are fully licensed by the City of Columbus Department of Public Safety License # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  Built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , Victorian Village Guest House is a dramatic loft suite in the carriage house adjacent to an (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Queen Anne home. It includes 850 square feet of living space tastefully furnished with antiques and modern amenities including a bedroom with queen sized bed, bathroom, great room with soaring 17 foot ceilings, a complete kitchen and en-suite laundry.  A twin day bed and twin trundle bed in the great room add sleeping for two additional guests.  The suite can accommodate 3 - 4 people. Guests can expect all the luxuries of an upscale hotel and all the comforts of home.  The g
host_about:
I'm a former banker who is now an entrepreneur. I love being self-employed in the tourism and hospitality industry as a guesthouse owner and host. I also curate art exhibits for a local university, setting up six exhibitions each year with local artists. 

I'm a big foodie who enjoys dining out, trying new restaurants and local taverns and brew pubs. I love cooking, home-keeping, gardening, collecting art and antiques and rescuing cats! Being a Certified Tourism Ambassador and an Airbnb host is the most fun job I've ever had.

name: Terrific Apt just south of OSU
description: What makes this apartment perfect is that it's your home away from home on a Victorian quiet street close to all your connections in the OSU, Wexner Medial Center, Battelle and Downtown areas. The latest technology with hi-fi and cable TV make this ideal for an extended stay and have the ability to make your own meals in a newly renovated kitchen with stainless appliances and granite counter tops. Beautiful hardwood floors, parking,and laundry add to your convenience and enjoyment. Nearby bus lines connect to many attractions including the Convention Center or suburban malls (Even directly to Nordstrom's Rack!), Short North Art District, Arena District, Huntington Ball Park, Schottenstein Center, OSU Stadium, the city bike trail, and the Chadwick Arboretum.  Excellent restaurants, local cafes, coffee shops, dry cleaners, grocery, Lennox shopping center with 24 AMC theaters, Verizon and AT&T shops, Barnes & Noble, and Target all have quick and easy access.
host_about: I am Linda a dynamic woman born in LA, but living most of my life in Columbus, Ohio.  I am very social and enjoy meeting new people.  I have traveled a great deal and enjoy knowing about new cultures and people.  Air bnb is a perfect opportunity for me to meet you and welcome you to a hospitable place to live here at one of my Villa Ruth apartments, which I named after my Grandma Ruth.

name: Heart of German Village
description: Prime spot in German Village, steps away from the Meeting Haus, some of the best restaurants in Columbus, Starbucks, and the Book Loft. Fully furnished bedroom with a queen-sized bed. Prime German Village location with two dedicated off-street parking spaces. My house is your house :) I work from home so am around all the time but keep to my home office in the daytime. Happy to provide suggestions to guests for tourist trips. To quote the neighborhood website, it sums it up perfectly... "German Village is a model of urban neighborhood preservation and revitalization." The self-guided walking tours are wonderful too! Incredibly close to the CoGo Bicycle share station, within the Car2Go car share zone, multiple bus lines through the neighborhood within a block or two from the house. -
host_about: Easy-going, laid back guy but keep a clean a house.

name: Mid-Century Sweet Little Apartment
description: This apartment is within walking distance to the Ohio State University, the Wexner Medical Center, and James Hospital.  Also, the Columbus Convention Center, Arena District, and downtown area are on a direct bus route with a connection half a block away.  I really like this apartment because it has an open concept and has a daybed in the living room for a guest.  Parking and laundry make this an ideal location for an extended stay. Having your own kitchen, desk, wi-fi, parking, laundry and cable TV--what could be better?!  Well, hardwood floors and a fenced-in back yard.  The Mid-Century decor and open floor plan make this apartment perfect for a short or long stay.  It's just off Neil and 5th, so it's within walking distance of OSU, or take the bus to campus or downtown.  The Short North art district is 2 miles away, but you can find either fine-dining, corner cafes, or an 80's club very near. The neighborhood is made up of mostly homeowners and some renters. Looking forwarding to meeting fellow travelers and host!

name: German Village Getaway
description: Beautiful German Village home available for rent. The German Village is a historic neighborhood located just south of Downtown. It's beautiful and located close to everything Columbus has to offer! This completely renovated historic home features 2 bedrooms (queen beds), 2 full baths, living room (with sectional & TV), dining room that's open to the kitchen, wifi, premium cable and apple TV. The backyard features a patio, grill and 2 car garage.  Conveniently located to all the Columbus attractions:  Steps to Schiller Park  2.5 miles to the Convention Center  7.7 miles to Port Columbus International Airport  1.2 miles to I71/I70  6.5 miles to Ohio Stadium  .9 miles to Nationwide Children's Hospital You won't be disappointed. The whole house and yard. I'm a ghost (unless of course you should need something) The German Village Society has a great website (sorry I can't include it here). Multiple Bike Share locations in the neighborhood. Columbus Car2Go. COTA #8 stops at the corner of the
host_about: Local Realtor, Property Owner and Dog Lover.

name: Short North Neat/Clean Apartment
description: My one bedroom apartment with a full size bed is just two blocks from High Street, Goodale Park, bus transportation and great restaurants. Wireless internet connection, cable TV, kitchen, laundry, hardwood floors make this little home perfect for an extended stay in downtown Columbus. The proximity to the Short North on a quiet street make this apartment with a balcony and basement private laundry the perfect place to stay. You'll have your own kitchen complete with dishwasher.  There's a private room in the basement where you can do your laundry.   The access to the Short North is absolutely wonderful.  The street T's into Park, then walk over to Hubbard and up to High  St. or over to Goodale Park.  Not much through traffic due to the street not going through to High St.  So it's rather private, but so close to everything.  Be sure to take advantage of the first Saturday Gallery Hop each month. The #5 bus  on High St. goes right on to the Convention Center, North Market o.r the State
host_about: I am Linda a dynamic woman born in LA, but living most of my life in Columbus, Ohio.  I am very social and enjoy meeting new people.  I have traveled a great deal and enjoy knowing about new cultures and people.  Air bnb is a perfect opportunity for me to meet you and welcome you to a hospitable place to live here at one of my Villa Ruth apartments, which I named after my Grandma Ruth.

Fun decor coupled with comfortable furnishings creates a unique, cozy feel in this two-story home.  Ceiling fans, central air/heat, Roku & Sling TV, and free parking & WiFi are just a few conveniences you will enjoy during your stay.  The King bedroom features a handmade upholstered bed with memory foam mattress and reclaimed wood accent wall.  This bedroom has a small, simple en suite bathroom with a small stall shower.   The Queen bedroom has a Serta mattress, vaulted ceiling and a ceiling fan. For parties of 5, the 5th guests is welcome to the couch or the bean bag that turns into a full size bed. We share the entrances but live in the basement and have our own full bath.  We will stay out of your way as much as possible and hope our guests feel they have plenty of privacy and space.  We have been hosting since 2012.  We are
host_about: I graduated from Ohio State in 2006 and subsequently completed my MBA at Capital.  I work in Outreach for a utility rebate program. I love to travel and host.  I am a Columbus enthusiast--I've been here since 2002 and absolutely love the city:  The people here are friendly and the homes in my neighborhood are charming.  I am happy to make recommendations for shopping, transportation, and dining in the area.  But I'm American so explaining our public transit is a struggle for me--we drive!

Located only 2 minutes from the highway, our home is situated in a prime location with access to a multitude of attractions, shopping, entertainment, and dining options all within 5-15 minutes, including Downtown Columbus, Port Columbus International Airport, Easton Town Center, Short North, & OSU. Complimentary coffee & tea is also available. We gladly welcome all long & short term reservations! Our home is located in a quiet, relaxing neighborhood with lots of walking paths, yet remarkably close to several key points of interest in the city. Depending on where you are going, it generally takes about 20 minutes to anywhere in the city! Guests are welcome to enjoy our home, including the guest room, guest bath, main living room, lower level living room, dining room, kitchen, laundry room, gym, and backyard deck. Old Oaks is centrally located off the Livingston Corridor on the Near East Side (a few miles SE of Broad and High, the center of downtown Columbus). My home is central to most attractions in town, but is within walking distance to Children's Hospital, so it may be of particular interest to families visiting the hospital or doctors doing rotations. I know nearly everything there is to know about Columbus, and if you're looking for more than a place to lay your head, I'm the host you want when visiting this city.

I spend most of my spare time reading, writing, running, dancing or riding my bicycle. I also enjoy a good happy hour and live shows.

name: Comfy bedroom with unshared bath near downtown
description: Extraordinary historic home on a 4-season landscaped lot with walking paths, just steps away from parks, minutes from downtown and airport. A YMCA is one block away. This porch is off the library that retains the sweet smell of  books that have been with the house since it was built in 1905. The remembrance of Jazz greats is a big part of the history of this house. Large bedroom with comfortable Queen size bed, bathroom next door to your room used only by you unless we have personal quests on 2nd floor.  Laundry is also on the 2nd floor. host_about: I am a garden consultant and arborist I love dogs, and all kinds of plants.

name: Tiny House Rainbow Bungalow
description: Our Rainbow Bungalow is a community built, artistic space.  A "tiny house" made with upcycled materials. This private stand alone structure shares the kitchen & bathroom inside the main house. Complete with wifi, memory foam bedding, and breezes from the river. An urban camping experience with no A/C. Welcome! to our "tiny house" Artist Bungalow :)  This space is much like urban camping but without the hassle of the tent and with the luxury of electricity, internet, and comfortable full size bedding. Guests are provided filtered water, towels, fresh bedding, shampoo, coffee and a list of places to eat.  The bungalow is completely yours, cozy & private. Right outside your door is a metro park AND an amazing bike path to travel the city. Along the river bike path, OSU is a beautiful 20 minute walk and 8 minute bike ride. The park is equipped with a brand new basketball court, tennis court, playground and shelter house. Bring your bike, basketball, or tennis rackets for extra adventure. T

This tiny home was built with love, creativity, and recycled materials.

Although, I'm rarely home I spend much of my time working in my studio just 5 min away.
I look forward to meet & greet & welcome you. 
YOU keep the artist bungalow alive :)

name: 1 Bedroom Lower Level Apartment
description: Comfortable, private 1 bedroom apartment within a beautiful historic house with tons of character.  Everything you need to feel at home when you are away from home.  Spacious and quiet designed for a relaxing stay.  Close to many popular attractions. Instead of just one room, for your price you get an entire apartment.  The space makes you feel like you are in your own home.  The space comes with satellite television and HBO.  If you are traveling with a group, the space sleeps 4 comfortably.  The location is steps away from public transportation and just minutes away from all areas of the city with easy access to the highways. With the apartment being a complete and separate living space, the guests have complete privacy from the rest of the house.  Guests are provided 24/7 access through a personalized code which will be given upon arrival. Your hosts Bill and Michael are both Certified Tourism Ambassadors for the City of Columbus and can offer insight into what to do while you are i
host_about:
Your hosts are Bill and Michael.  

Bill is a licensed real estate agent and Certified Tourism Ambassador.  He loves to travel and has been to many places around the globe.  He is fun and energetic and loves to meet new people.  

Michael is an all around artist. He is a professional songwriter and producer, photographer, filmmaker and writer.  He has a great sense of humor and loves to have fun.

name: Modern/Historic with a street view.
description: Wonderful room in peaceful Schumacher Place next to the heart of German Village. Nearby restaurants, Parks, shops, galleries, and close to downtown. Full Continental Breakfast included. LGBT friendly. The house is over 100 years old but you would not know it. Except for the wonderful wood floors and the original brick street that it sits on.  Private bedroom on the second floor with windows facing to the east. Guest will have full access to use the shared living spaces, Living room, dinning room, Kitchen and back yard. I will have a continental breakfast put out each morning. If you like to cook you are more then welcome to use the Kitchen as long as you clean up. You have a privet bathroom on the first floor. I do live in the house with my partner Mark we will come and go as normal. We are friendly guy's so if you have any questions about the area or things to do don't hesitate to ask. The neighborhood is really nice and I know all of  my neighbors. Everyone is really nice and willing
host_about:
I am a very active individual and enjoy being outside when possible. My favorites things to do are Rowing, Swimming, Biking, Running, Triathlons, hiking and just working in the yard. I have worked in Hospitality for a long time starting in restaurants in high school. I now work at a Hilton and when I retire I plan open a B&B in Saugatuck/Douglas Michigan. 

I do both traveling and hosting on Airbnb and love both. Its just great to meet different people and visit different places. If there is anything you would like to know about Columbus when you are here don't be shy!! If I am staying with you I know I wont be shy to ask about the area.

I do love animals and have a dog of my own named Chance. He is weimaraner and is just over a year old. He is a great big bundle of joy and is always willing to play a game of fetch.

I do have a life motto that I got from my favorite book the peaceful warrior. It is there simple words - paradox, humor, and change. If you know the book you know the meaning if you have not read the book you should. It is a great conversation piece if I am staying at your place or if you are staying at mine just ask I would be more then willing to explain. 

Happy Traveling

name: Your  Home in Columbus ,Ohio 43230
description: Private  bathroom  in hallway. Attached Garage Guest can share the living room , dinning area and kitchen I am always available for any questions via text,I am flexible to socialize with guest if needed. Neighborhood  very nice and quite,house location is very close to restaurants, grocery stores,Easton mall and airport. There are buss stops in 1 mile walk distance, uber ,taxi and rental cars are also option

I am easy going person with lost of hobbies, Travelling is one of  passion . I have been on the roads so many times , I had opportunity to see England, France ,Italy Germany, Denmark ,Turkey ,Hong Kong, Singapore, Canada  and USA. Would like to see many more :), I love meeting  with new people ,I have stayed 4 months in England with a lovely host family. Enjoyed my staying in their safe home  and would like to provide same  comfort to my guests .
thank you for the opportunity !.

name: Entire place in Short North w/ parking spot
description: Newly remodeled 1000 Sq. ft. Townhome that includes 1 bedroom (queen size bed with foam top), with memory foam pillows, 1 and 1/2 baths, kitchen, and living room. Tub in 1/2 bath is not for use. Shower is for use in the downstairs bathroom.  Stairs are steeper than normal so use caution on stairs.  Free parking spot for 1 car.  Couch IS NOT allowed for guests to sleep on. Easy checkin with smart lock. No exchange of keys! A historic home built in 1880 located in short north, a lively street filled with shops, art galleries, pubs, and restaurants. The home is also walking distance to downtown and Nationwide Arena as well as OSU campus and OSU Medical Center. The first floor has a comfortable living room with a flat screen tv, wifi, Netflix, and electric fireplace. Fresh toiletries, towels, sheets, etc will be provided. There is a also an iron, ironing board, washing machine and dryer should you need to use. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need and Kroger grocery store
host_about: I'm from Cleveland, OH and travel during work and my off days.

name: Airport Bedroom w/ Loft near Bexley + Bathroom!
description: Come home to a house on the outskirts of historic Bexley dripping with charm! A mere 7 minutes drive to the airport this space is perfect for business travelers, flight attendants and those that want jet setter convenience.  The house is in a lovely neighborhood with roundabouts, brick homes and stately charm. The loft is your private oasis. The loft space is the entire second floor and includes a bedroom, private bathroom and simple loft for relaxation or an early morning yoga session. Spacious room in a beautiful home with modern updates. The room is standard size with a moderately sized closet and shelving. It has a queen bed, drawer night stand and bright sunny window that allows natural light to flood in. You'll love this gorgeous historic neighborhood with its roundabouts and stately homes. This room also has access to a loft space. The loft is an open area at the top of the stairs. It does not have full walls but it is great for relaxing, watching TV or having a stretch. Enjoy!
host_about: Cool, scientist - we do exist. :-)

name: Private 3rd floor room close to OSU & Short North!
description: Here's your own private 3rd floor bedroom only 3 blocks from OSU campus & High St! There's a full size futon & full air mattress in the room. It's very basic, but if you need a place to crash while you explore Columbus this is the perfect location. Roommates are a mix of male/female young professionals/grad students. Walking distance or short Uber to Short North/Italian Village/Victorian Village/Arena District/Downtown/Grandview/Clintonville. Surrounded by tons of bars, restaurants, & nightlife! 3rd floor room is quiet and private with a full-size futon as well as computer desk with chair and lamp. Plenty of floor space for another air mattress.  Also a huge walk-in closet large enough for another air mattress! Feel free to hang out in the entire spacious first floor common living space. Hang out, watch TV, cook, or strum a guitar.  We also have one of the sweetest and largest decks in the neighborhood! Roommates will be in and out throughout the day.  I can gladly point you in the dir
host_about: Fun, adventurous, tall dude from Ohio.  Lover of music festivals, omelettes and train travel.  I've ventured all over this great country and have had enough experiences for several lifetimes!

name: Historic home near German Village
description: Large charming, historic home thoughtfully renovated with all modern comforts. Conveniently located 2 blocks from Children's hospital and within walking distance to wonderful dining in German Village and Schumacher Place. Minutes to I-71 and I-70. Three full floors of living space. Large living room with flat screen tv., charming dining room and gorgeous cooks kitchen for your delight. Generous size bedrooms with ample closet space and fully updated bathrooms. Guests have access to either 2 or 3 floors depending upon the number of guests and how many beds are required.  Also there is a host's storage area which is not available.  With either 2 or 3 floors, the common areas of kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry  room are always available. An area guide is provided highlighting local dining spots and activities. The house is located within 2 blocks of Nationside Children's Hospital, making it an ideal spot for those with family members being treated there. Parking is off street a

name: Cozy 3 Bed Short North area duplex, Sleeps 8
description: This 3 Bed, 1 Bath apartment is part of a renovated historic 1910 duplex. Located in Weinland Park, 2 blocks from High St. & the Short North. A short walk to many popular bars and restaurants nearby or a $5-10 Uber ride to downtown. Distance from: 1.3 mi - Columbus Convention Center 2 mi - OSU stadium 2.3 mi - Schottenstein Center 2.5 mi - Crew Stadium/Expo Center/Fair grounds 3 mi radius - all Downtown areas Please be sure to check out our other listings under our profile nearby! The apartment can easily accommodate both small and large groups. If you have an especially large group, we have 3 other listings nearby on Airbnb called Cozy, Urban I, and Urban II (see listings under our profile). The first floor level has an open kitchen and living area complete with WIFI & cable TV and plenty of seating. Next to the first floor living/kitchen space is the 3rd bedroom with twin bed and seating area.  The 3rd bedroom has also the front entrance to the apartment.  For groups utilizing the 3r
host_about:
Mike and Ingrid met in Japan, moved to Columbus in 2009, and have been loving it ever since!  Both are experienced travelers (25+ countries on 5 continents between us) & enjoy renovating historic homes and building new homes.

"We love being hosts- providing a comfy home and delivering a unique experience when visiting our city. We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & food establishments- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!"
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

name: Comfortable room in German Village
description: Private room in a 2 bedroom house in German Village. A comfortable queen-sized bed, closet space, fresh towels and full use of the common area downstairs. Fenced in backyard with grill and fire pit. Short walk to Schiller Park, 10 mins from downtown. Easy and free off street parking right next to our house. You have access to the entire downstairs. Equipped kitchen with gas stove, coffee maker and tea kettle (no microwave). Living room has large couch and flat screen TV with Netflix and HBO go available. Washer and Dryer available. Shared bathroom with us. Fenced in backyard has chairs, gas grill, fire pit, and small garden. Your room has pillow top Queen bed, hair dryer, and plenty of space for your belongings. We would love to welcome you to our home and show you around the city if you would like, or we can just offer you a place to crash for the night. You will have your own key so you can come and go as you like. We do not work traditional hours, so we will be in and out as well. G
host_about: We are a newly married couple enjoying living in the city of Columbus.  We are very active people and love playing sports, hiking, camping and going on bike rides.  We love traveling and going on adventures as well as exploring our own city.  Ryan works locally as a Tennis pro and Teresa is a nurse at The Ohio State University Med Center.  We love meeting new people and would love to show you around our city, or just provide a space so you can explore on your own.

name: Comfy room close to OSU/downtown!
description: We live in the popular Grandview Heights area of Columbus, rated a very unique and walkable area! We love Columbus and know all of the hot spots to check out!  We are a just a quick trip from downtown, OSU, and all of the fun districts! Relaxing private room with a queen size bed!   The room has a dresser, closet and minifridge stocked with drinks/snacks.  There are extra blankets and pillows also in the room, if needed.  The bathroom is just out in the hallway and is stocked with towels, toiletries and all bathroom essentials you may need, including a hairdryer and iron/ironing board. Guests have access to the bedroom, a full bathroom and living area on the first floor. Andrew and I will be available to help with anything you may need but are often running around enjoying our great city!  Let us know if we can be of service in any way during your stay! We live in the charming Fifth by Northwest area of Columbus.  We are just a few miles from the Arena district, Short North, OSU, and d
host_about: I am a lifelong Columbus resident who loves all of the new and exciting things going on here!  I love to travel, love sports and the outdoors!

name: Spacious Master Suite (Street View)
description: Large room with Lock+Keys. Queen bed (memory foam). Self Check-In after 3pm. Guest parking (3) or on-street anytime. WiFi, Cable TV, Air-Conditioner & Heating. Continental Breakfast. 2 Bikes Available. Antique-Style Furnishing. Immediately upon booking you will get individual house & room access codes as well as the WiFi code.  You have access to 1st floor common area including the kitchen and your 2nd floor room, as well as 1st and 2nd floor bathrooms. You may store large items in the common area or the basement and wash your clothes there as well One of us (Sergei or Ethan) will be available at all times via text or phone. Sergei stays in the house on the 3rd floor and Ethan lives across the street. We try to give our guests a balance of privacy and engaging conversation. We can recommend some places to visit as well as well as assist with any difficulties as best as we can Our house is located 1 block away from the Ohio State Fair Grounds and within 10 min walk from the edge of OSU
host_about:
We have been long-time hosts and are passionate about hosting travelers of all varieties, when we cannot be traveling ourselves. When we aren't hosting, you may see Brandon or Sam (our trusted friends) helping out around the house, as Jenna is a full-time nanny and Ethan is a full-time landscaper. Although we are not born natives to Columbus (Jenna originates from just north of London, England and Ethan hails from Cincinnati, Ohio), we have adopted Columbus as our own and would be happy to send along any recommendations about our lovely city.

Please do not hesitate to contact us, as we would be delighted to host you.

name: Tulsa #3 Nicely Priced Bedroom
description: North End Columbus, Busline only 2.5 blocks away.  Rooms are large, friendly people, and 3.5 bathrooms.  Wifi, cable in bedroom, two living rooms, and a dining room.  Free laundry, and two refrigerators.  Great Deal, single occupancy. The space is single occupancy and includes a locked bedroom and share of the rest of the large home. Can access any part of the home except others bedroom and the garage. Yes, help is provided by myself or others that work to provide the best stay possible. The neighborhood is on the north end of Columbus 10 minutes to Ohio State University.  15 minutes north of downtown or the airport 2 blocks to bus line.  Can park on the property or the street in front of home The place is very quiet and professional.  I.e., no parties or pets, please.
host_about: Nice guy

name: Tulsa #1 Large House Master Bedroom
description: Nice large home on the north end of Columbus with off street parking, as well as on the bus line.  WiFi, cable, two living rooms, and a dining room.  Free laundry, locking bedrooms, private bathroom.  Close to shopping and Interstate 71. The home is set up like a hotel and includes a private bath.  So all guest come and go as they please. Kitchen and rest of home, including free Wi-Fi. I will not interact with guests unless asked to.  I do not live in the home it's 100% reserved for our guests. North end neighborhood includes shopping, banks, libraries and restaurants.  Close to  Easton shopping and Worthington, Clintonville, and Westerville. The is a public bus system within 2 blocks.  The airport is only 12 miles away.  The interstate is only 3 blocks from the home. The home is come and go as you like and very affordable.  There is cable, WiFi, and a refrigerator in the room as well as a full bath.  There are free laundry machines.  Nice large rooms and lots of privacy.
host_about: Nice guy

name: Tulsa #4 Nicely Priced Bedroom
description: Nice large home on the north side of Columbus.  Close to The Ohio State University, Downtown, and Interstate 71. Off street parking. Large rooms!  Book bedroom and share rest of house. Can use entire home in common areas.  Others' bedrooms are excluded. I interact on an as needed basis.  I do not live there, but stay close by.  Guests can call me anytime, 24 hours a day at (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Easton is a short stay away, as well as the Polaris Fashion Place, The Ohio State University, Worthington Ohio, Downtown, ...... COTA bus stop is two blocks away.   Uber is helpful.  There is off street and on street parking. Call me anytime if there are questions (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
host_about: Nice guy

name: Luxury Short North home 3br/3.5b
description: Built in 2006, this brick Italian Village home offers tons of character, comfort, and convenience. Spacious three bedroom, each with its own attached full bathroom, house with two separate living areas (finished basement). Perfect for large groups and families! Guests have access to the house and back patio. Only the garage is closed off to guests I like to give my guests space but I love providing recommendations! This neighborhood is classy, quiet, and very convenient. Just blocks from the house, travelers can find the best food, art, entertainment, nightlife, and accessible Columbus has to offer.  Conveniently located: - 3 blocks east of Short North - 5 blocks south of OSU campus - 5 blocks north of downtown - 7 blocks southeast of OSU Wexner Medical Center - 9 blocks north of The Greater Columbus Convention Center - 10 blocks northeast of Nationwide Arena - a mile from Crew Stadium Bus, COGO (bikeshare),  and Uber Parking on the street is free, within the designated parameters!
host_about: Easy going guy that loves to travel and socialize

name: 1BR Apt. on Clintonville Ravine
description: Lovely  2-story, 1BR apartment located in the South Clintonville/North University District area, minutes from OSU or downtown.  It overlooks the Glen Echo Ravine, is comfortably furnished, and is ideal for a single or couple who are visiting Columbus The apartment is located on a busy street (Indianola), but its entrance is behind a 2-car garage and has an entry deck and covered entry porch.  The space is on two levels, with an eat-in kitchen on the entry level, and a living room, bedroom, and bath on the upper level.  The kitchen space and the living room space both have wonderful views of the ravine greenery with its many birds and other wildlife.  The kitchen space has easy access to the entry deck that also overlooks the ravine and has seating so you can relax outdoors.  The eat-in kitchen has a 24" electric stove, a bottom-freezer refrigerator, a microwave, and generous counter and cabinet space.  It's fully supplied with dishes, pans, and silverware, and has a toaster and a drip
host_about: I have lived in Columbus off and on since coming here to attend Ohio State University in the 60's.  I have a degree in Architecture from OSU, but my real interest has always been in renovations. I have a son who lives in San Francisco and I love to visit there several times a year.  My husband and I have 3 grandchildren - one in California and two in Michigan.  I recently retired from OSU after working there for 18 years.

name: Beautiful condo in downtown
description: Loft condo, just under 570 sq. ft., soaring ceilings, 1 bed 1 bath, hardwood floors throughout, stainless appliances, and 10 ft. picture windows. Salt & pepper granite counters. Queen size bed. Tons of off street parking. The minimum rental period on this unit is 30 days, a lease agreement will be needed between both parties. Please email with questions! Loft condo, just under 570 sq. ft., soaring ceilings, 1 bed 1 bath, hardwood floors throughout, stainless appliances, and 10 ft. picture windows. Salt & pepper granite counters. Queen size bed. Tons of off street parking. The unit has plates cups and silverware, however there are no cooking utensils. The minimum rental period on this unit is 30 days**

name: Downtown Grant Hospital Area Lovely Apt
description: My place is close to Grant Hospital, the main library, historic German Village, Downtown Columbus, Children's Hospital restaurants and dining, nightlife, public transport. You'll love my place because you can walk anywhere here in Downtown Columbus. Best suited I'd say for the Business Professional, Doctor  or anyone needing to be close to Downtown. This is an apt, your home in Columbus to make your trip the best you could imagine, My place is good for business travelers. You have a furnished apt in downtown Columbus. A Queen Size Foam mattress bed. Gas Stove, Dishwasher. TV with internet cable Apple TV, Washer Dryer. I work in German Village as a maintenance man and play Piano around town. Chief Johnny Lonesome is the name of my group and you can do a search on the internet and that's me You're just a couple blocks north of Historic German Village and right on the Southeast corner of Downtown Columbus. The restaurants I'm listing are 1 to 10 blocks away McDonald (Website hidden by Air
host_about:
I am a musician that plays a New Orleans style piano ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) ) and a maintenance man of seventy six units in beautiful German Village Ohio. I'm more of the intellect type who ponders things like quantum theory and mysticism . I rehab homes and occasionally flip properties. Like my Mom I just love everybody but like my Dad I refrain to "what about No don't you understand" INTP is my Myers Briggs personality test conclusion which is less than 3% of personalities tested. And one of my favorite sayings is a 
fats Domino quote shared to me by Charles Neville that states "One never does no one, do one"

name: Perfect Clintonville Pre-fabulous in 1950s Cottage
description: Come stay with us in our charming 1950s pre-fab cottage in the heart of Columbus's quirky, peaceful Clintonville neighborhood. Just a short walk or ride away from High Street -- the city's central cultural artery -- and the no. 2 and 4 bus lines, and with lots of clean, mid-century and vintage charm. We offer plenty of street parking, nice sheets & blankets, a chemical-free home, filtered water, summertime garden views, and, best of all: free hangs w/ the world's cutest border collie, Isaly! Our darling little cape cottage is a part of one of Columbus' original mid-century housing developments -- right smack-dab in the middle of Clintonville. Our house features three bedrooms, a centrally-located bathroom, spacious study, 1950s-style living room and loft bedroom upstairs. Your room is a clean, crisp bedroom that overlooks the backyard, with great morning sun and a mid-century-modern-meets-farm-country-chiq decor -- we're early to bed and early to rise, so your space will be quiet and c
host_about:
hi there! i'm jess -- a folklorist, oral historian and  columbus, ohio native with a really amazing border collie pup, named isaly. 

my partner jeff & i are both currently grad students -- he studies the history of industrialization and labor in the u.s. south through a history of science & technology phd. program based in philly, and i'm a folklorist and oral historian who works on the history of sustainable agriculture, food & environmental justice, & everyday perceptions of environmental toxicity. that means i get to road-trip around this fine state alot, asking people questions about how they connect food and environment health, and how they've had their lives shaped  around those questions. 

as a folklorist and oral historian, i believe in the power of everyday people's embodied and lived knowledge and experience; and my work is in documenting, interpreting and helping to present these powerful perspectives to wider audiences, to create conversations for change. i try to bring these passions to everything in my life.

i'm interested in the ways people connect food, health and environmental concern; and movement histories and futures of activism around the stuff that makes us sick, and the stuff that makes us healthy. basically, if you wanna talk farm magazines from the 1950s or the poisons & boons of various audio recorders or just like food in general, i'm yr grrl! 

because of my own history of exposure and chemical sensitivity, we try to keep (as much as possible) a non-toxic home, free of meats, chemical cleaners, and scents. and, if you come in summer or fall, you're free to help harvest goodies from our bountiful yard garden! (the "yarden.") it can get a bit weedy this time of year; but it's all chem-free and very well loved.

columbus, ohio is my hometown (and my favorite city on earth), and we're so blessed to get to do cultural work in and around the good and environmental systems in this lovely place. we absolutely love showing people this city -- from cultural tours to the best nature spots to restaurants (even pokmon)! 

our wonderful brilliant border collie isaly will be your prime host -- she loves our guests and will happily throw you some tricks (her newest one is "step up and kisses") and some cuddles. we also have a lovely matching kitty named nella. 

we love meeting people from all around the world, and sharing our love for our little city and its wonderful culture. we can't wait to meet you!

name: Charming (& Spacious) Clintonville Cape Cod Loft!
description: This room is the entire 2nd floor of our darling mid-century cape cod-style cottage in Clintonville. With original French windows, wall-to-wall wooden shelving, and charming farmhouse-meets-midcentury vintage decor, this place is a cozy retreat in the heart of our city! Picture your cool aunt/grandma's amazing cozy finished attic space - but without any of those weird hand-me-downs. This space features a luxurious full-size bed, vintage lounge chair and ottoman, and several charming restored farmhouse pieces -- including repurposed orchard crates and even a roost from a 1850s chicken coop! The room also has storage galore for the weary traveler: built-in-wooden shelving all along the stairwell, a darling tiny closet-space, and all the pegboards yr heart could desire. Our loft is the perfect snug hideaway, summer or winter. With the large plush full-size bed, extra-long couch, comfy dad upholstered chair and ample wooden built-in shelving, this is the ideal suite for vintage-loving trav
